intro: Chamaecytisus spinescens var. candidus, commonly known as the white broom, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features slender, thorny stems and produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy shrub suitable for coastal and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
